text: Erythrolamprus epinephalus is a species of snake in the Colubridae family. It is endemic to South America. The snake, which was described by Edward Drinker Cope in 1862, is notable for its apparent immunity to the toxic skin of the Golden poison dart frog, which it preys upon. == References == Category:Reptiles described in 1862 Category:Erythrolamprus
title: Erythrolamprus epinephalus
